modules.description: This module runs asynchronous jobs with formatted start and finish messages, ensuring correct output interleaving. It takes a function to execute asynchronously and a format string for messages, returning the result of the job. Useful for tracking progress of concurrent tasks like file downloads or batch computations.

This module represents a choice in an interactive command-line interface, pairing a character input with a value and a description. It supports creating choices with `create` and marking a default choice with `default`. Concrete use cases include building menus or prompts where user input selects an option mapped to a specific action or value.

This module handles interactive command-line input and output with asynchronous support, providing functions like `print_string`, `ask_yn`, and `ask_dispatch_with_help` to display messages and collect user responses conditionally or unconditionally. It works with strings, asynchronous deferred values, and structured choices to build interactive prompts, including yes/no questions, menu selections, and arithmetic challenges. Concrete use cases include implementing interactive CLI tools, user confirmation prompts, and step-by-step setup wizards with formatted output and optional paging.
